headline: Holiday Cocktail or Mocktail Recipe: Festive Cranberry Fizz
name: Holiday Cocktail or Mocktail Recipe: Festive Cranberry Fizz
recipeIngredient: 2 ounces fresh ginger, skin on and sliced (about 1/2 cup)
3 cups cranberry juice cocktail, no sugar added
1/4 ounce black tea leaves (decaffeinated if desired)
1/4 cup pomegranate molasses, without any added sweeteners
1/4 cup non-alcoholic orange bitters, such as Fee Brothers

recipeInstructions.text: Blitz the cranberries and ginger in a food processor until roughly chopped, then mix with the sugar and cranberry juice cocktail in a 3-quart saucepan. Bring to a boil, then add the rosemary. Lower the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Let cool, ideally overnight in the refrigerator. Strain through a fine mesh strainer and discard the solids. You should have about 3 cups of thin syrup. Syrup can be refrigerated for up to 1 week or frozen.

Place the tea leaves in a large heatproof bowl. Pour the boiling water over them and steep for 3 minutes. Strain out the leaves, and whisk in the Cranberry Rosemary Syrup, pomegranate molasses, and orange bitters.
Refrigerate the punch mix for at least 4 hours, or overnight.
To serve a non-alcoholic drink, stir the punch mix together with 6 to 7 cups tonic water. Serve over ice. Makes about 18 6-ounce servings.
To serve an alcoholic drink, stir the punch mix together with 2 cups gin and 4 to 5 cups tonic water. Serve over ice. Makes about 18 6-ounce servings.
